title: The Maxisum Model for Facility Dispersion Problem
description: In some facility location problems, facilities need to be positioned so that the influence of one doesnâ€™t overshadow or adversely affect the others. Suppose the distances (or some other dispersion metric) between two locations are computed in advance. The discrete maxisum problem must define the location of p facilities among a set of discrete nodes to maximize the sum of distances (or the average of distances) computed between all pairs of selected facilities.

parameter.name: p
parameter.description: the number of facilities to be selected

variable.name: x
variable.description: the value of 1 if a location `i` is selected and 0 otherwise

variable.name: z
variable.description: the binary variable that indicates both nodes `i` and `j` are selected

objective.name: MaxTotalDistance
objective.description: the total distance between selected locations
